020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle;
021
022import java.io.File;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024import java.util.Collection;
025import java.util.HashMap;
026import java.util.HashSet;
027import java.util.Locale;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.SortedSet;
031import java.util.TreeSet;
032
033import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck;
034import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck;
035import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean;
036import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException;
037import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.Configuration;
038import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.Context;
039import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
040import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.ExternalResourceHolder;
041import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.FileContents;
042import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.FileText;
043import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.LocalizedMessage;
044import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
045
046/**
047 * Responsible for walking an abstract syntax tree and notifying interested
048 * checks at each each node.
049 *
050 */
051@FileStatefulCheck
052public final class TreeWalker extends AbstractFileSetCheck implements ExternalResourceHolder {
053
054    /** Maps from token name to ordinary checks. */
055    private final Map<String, Set<AbstractCheck>> tokenToOrdinaryChecks =
056        new HashMap<>();
057
058    /** Maps from token name to comment checks. */
059    private final Map<String, Set<AbstractCheck>> tokenToCommentChecks =
060            new HashMap<>();
061
062    /** Registered ordinary checks, that don't use comment nodes. */
063    private final Set<AbstractCheck> ordinaryChecks = new HashSet<>();
064
065    /** Registered comment checks. */
066    private final Set<AbstractCheck> commentChecks = new HashSet<>();
067
068    /** The ast filters. */
069    private final Set<TreeWalkerFilter> filters = new HashSet<>();
070
071    /** The sorted set of messages. */
072    private final SortedSet<LocalizedMessage> messages = new TreeSet<>();
073
074    /** Context of child components. */
075    private Context childContext;
076
077    /** A factory for creating submodules (i.e. the Checks) */
078    private ModuleFactory moduleFactory;
079
080    /**
081     * Creates a new {@code TreeWalker} instance.
082     */
083    public TreeWalker() {
084        setFileExtensions("java");
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Sets the module factory for creating child modules (Checks).
089     * @param moduleFactory the factory
090     */
091    public void setModuleFactory(ModuleFactory moduleFactory) {
092        this.moduleFactory = moduleFactory;
093    }
094
095    @Override
096    public void finishLocalSetup() {
097        final DefaultContext checkContext = new DefaultContext();
098        checkContext.add("severity", getSeverity());
099        checkContext.add("tabWidth", String.valueOf(getTabWidth()));
100        childContext = checkContext;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * {@inheritDoc} Creates child module.
105     * @noinspection ChainOfInstanceofChecks
106     */
107    @Override
108    public void setupChild(Configuration childConf)
109            throws CheckstyleException {
110        final String name = childConf.getName();
111        final Object module;
112
113        try {
114            module = moduleFactory.createModule(name);
115            if (module instanceof AutomaticBean) {
116                final AutomaticBean bean = (AutomaticBean) module;
117                bean.contextualize(childContext);
118                bean.configure(childConf);
119            }
120        }
121        catch (final CheckstyleException ex) {
122            throw new CheckstyleException("cannot initialize module " + name
123                    + " - " + ex.getMessage(), ex);
124        }
125        if (module instanceof AbstractCheck) {
126            final AbstractCheck check = (AbstractCheck) module;
127            check.init();
128            registerCheck(check);
129        }
130        else if (module instanceof TreeWalkerFilter) {
131            final TreeWalkerFilter filter = (TreeWalkerFilter) module;
132            filters.add(filter);
133        }
134        else {
135            throw new CheckstyleException(
136                "TreeWalker is not allowed as a parent of " + name
137                        + " Please review 'Parent Module' section for this Check in web"
138                        + " documentation if Check is standard.");
139        }
140    }
141
142    @Override
143    protected void processFiltered(File file, FileText fileText) throws CheckstyleException {
144        // check if already checked and passed the file
145        if (!ordinaryChecks.isEmpty() || !commentChecks.isEmpty()) {
146            final FileContents contents = getFileContents();
147            final DetailAST rootAST = JavaParser.parse(contents);
148            if (!ordinaryChecks.isEmpty()) {
149                walk(rootAST, contents, AstState.ORDINARY);
150            }
151            if (!commentChecks.isEmpty()) {
152                final DetailAST astWithComments = JavaParser.appendHiddenCommentNodes(rootAST);
153                walk(astWithComments, contents, AstState.WITH_COMMENTS);
154            }
155            if (filters.isEmpty()) {
156                addMessages(messages);
157            }
158            else {
159                final SortedSet<LocalizedMessage> filteredMessages =
160                    getFilteredMessages(file.getAbsolutePath(), contents, rootAST);
161                addMessages(filteredMessages);
162            }
163            messages.clear();
164        }
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Returns filtered set of {@link LocalizedMessage}.
169     * @param fileName path to the file
170     * @param fileContents the contents of the file
171     * @param rootAST root AST element {@link DetailAST} of the file
172     * @return filtered set of messages
173     */
174    private SortedSet<LocalizedMessage> getFilteredMessages(
175            String fileName, FileContents fileContents, DetailAST rootAST) {
176        final SortedSet<LocalizedMessage> result = new TreeSet<>(messages);
177        for (LocalizedMessage element : messages) {
178            final TreeWalkerAuditEvent event =
179                    new TreeWalkerAuditEvent(fileContents, fileName, element, rootAST);
180            for (TreeWalkerFilter filter : filters) {
181                if (!filter.accept(event)) {
182                    result.remove(element);
183                    break;
184                }
185            }
186        }
187        return result;
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Register a check for a given configuration.
192     * @param check the check to register
193     * @throws CheckstyleException if an error occurs
194     */
195    private void registerCheck(AbstractCheck check) throws CheckstyleException {
196        final int[] tokens;
197        final Set<String> checkTokens = check.getTokenNames();
198        if (checkTokens.isEmpty()) {
199            tokens = check.getDefaultTokens();
200        }
201        else {
202            tokens = check.getRequiredTokens();
203
204            // register configured tokens
205            final int[] acceptableTokens = check.getAcceptableTokens();
206            Arrays.sort(acceptableTokens);
207            for (String token : checkTokens) {
208                final int tokenId = TokenUtil.getTokenId(token);
209                if (Arrays.binarySearch(acceptableTokens, tokenId) >= 0) {
210                    registerCheck(token, check);
211                }
212                else {
213                    final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Token \"%s\" was "
214                            + "not found in Acceptable tokens list in check %s",
215                            token, check.getClass().getName());
216                    throw new CheckstyleException(message);
217                }
218            }
219        }
220        for (int element : tokens) {
221            registerCheck(element, check);
222        }
223        if (check.isCommentNodesRequired()) {
224            commentChecks.add(check);
225        }
226        else {
227            ordinaryChecks.add(check);
228        }
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Register a check for a specified token id.
233     * @param tokenId the id of the token
234     * @param check the check to register
235     * @throws CheckstyleException if Check is misconfigured
236     */
237    private void registerCheck(int tokenId, AbstractCheck check) throws CheckstyleException {
238        registerCheck(TokenUtil.getTokenName(tokenId), check);
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Register a check for a specified token name.
243     * @param token the name of the token
244     * @param check the check to register
245     * @throws CheckstyleException if Check is misconfigured
246     */
247    private void registerCheck(String token, AbstractCheck check) throws CheckstyleException {
248        if (check.isCommentNodesRequired()) {
249            tokenToCommentChecks.computeIfAbsent(token, empty -> new HashSet<>()).add(check);
250        }
251        else if (TokenUtil.isCommentType(token)) {
252            final String message = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Check '%s' waits for comment type "
253                    + "token ('%s') and should override 'isCommentNodesRequired()' "
254                    + "method to return 'true'", check.getClass().getName(), token);
255            throw new CheckstyleException(message);
256        }
257        else {
258            tokenToOrdinaryChecks.computeIfAbsent(token, empty -> new HashSet<>()).add(check);
259        }
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Initiates the walk of an AST.
264     * @param ast the root AST
265     * @param contents the contents of the file the AST was generated from.
266     * @param astState state of AST.
267     */
268    private void walk(DetailAST ast, FileContents contents,
269            AstState astState) {
270        notifyBegin(ast, contents, astState);
271        processIter(ast, astState);
272        notifyEnd(ast, astState);
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * Notify checks that we are about to begin walking a tree.
277     * @param rootAST the root of the tree.
278     * @param contents the contents of the file the AST was generated from.
279     * @param astState state of AST.
280     */
281    private void notifyBegin(DetailAST rootAST, FileContents contents,
282            AstState astState) {
283        final Set<AbstractCheck> checks;
284
285        if (astState == AstState.WITH_COMMENTS) {
286            checks = commentChecks;
287        }
288        else {
289            checks = ordinaryChecks;
290        }
291
292        for (AbstractCheck check : checks) {
293            check.setFileContents(contents);
294            check.clearMessages();
295            check.beginTree(rootAST);
296        }
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * Notify checks that we have finished walking a tree.
301     * @param rootAST the root of the tree.
302     * @param astState state of AST.
303     */
304    private void notifyEnd(DetailAST rootAST, AstState astState) {
305        final Set<AbstractCheck> checks;
306
307        if (astState == AstState.WITH_COMMENTS) {
308            checks = commentChecks;
309        }
310        else {
311            checks = ordinaryChecks;
312        }
313
314        for (AbstractCheck check : checks) {
315            check.finishTree(rootAST);
316            messages.addAll(check.getMessages());
317        }
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Notify checks that visiting a node.
322     * @param ast the node to notify for.
323     * @param astState state of AST.
324     */
325    private void notifyVisit(DetailAST ast, AstState astState) {
326        final Collection<AbstractCheck> visitors = getListOfChecks(ast, astState);
327
328        if (visitors != null) {
329            for (AbstractCheck check : visitors) {
330                check.visitToken(ast);
331            }
332        }
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Notify checks that leaving a node.
337     * @param ast
338     *        the node to notify for
339     * @param astState state of AST.
340     */
341    private void notifyLeave(DetailAST ast, AstState astState) {
342        final Collection<AbstractCheck> visitors = getListOfChecks(ast, astState);
343
344        if (visitors != null) {
345            for (AbstractCheck check : visitors) {
346                check.leaveToken(ast);
347            }
348        }
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Method returns list of checks.
353     *
354     * @param ast
355     *            the node to notify for
356     * @param astState
357     *            state of AST.
358     * @return list of visitors
359     */
360    private Collection<AbstractCheck> getListOfChecks(DetailAST ast, AstState astState) {
361        final Collection<AbstractCheck> visitors;
362        final String tokenType = TokenUtil.getTokenName(ast.getType());
363
364        if (astState == AstState.WITH_COMMENTS) {
365            visitors = tokenToCommentChecks.get(tokenType);
366        }
367        else {
368            visitors = tokenToOrdinaryChecks.get(tokenType);
369        }
370        return visitors;
371    }
372
373    @Override
374    public void destroy() {
375        ordinaryChecks.forEach(AbstractCheck::destroy);
376        commentChecks.forEach(AbstractCheck::destroy);
377        super.destroy();
378    }
379
380    @Override
381    public Set<String> getExternalResourceLocations() {
382        final Set<String> ordinaryChecksResources =
383                getExternalResourceLocationsOfChecks(ordinaryChecks);
384        final Set<String> commentChecksResources =
385                getExternalResourceLocationsOfChecks(commentChecks);
386        final Set<String> filtersResources =
387                getExternalResourceLocationsOfFilters();
388        final int resultListSize = commentChecksResources.size()
389                + ordinaryChecksResources.size()
390                + filtersResources.size();
391        final Set<String> resourceLocations = new HashSet<>(resultListSize);
392        resourceLocations.addAll(ordinaryChecksResources);
393        resourceLocations.addAll(commentChecksResources);
394        resourceLocations.addAll(filtersResources);
395        return resourceLocations;
396    }
397
398    /**
399     * Returns a set of external configuration resource locations which are used by the filters set.
400     * @return a set of external configuration resource locations which are used by the filters set.
401     */
402    private Set<String> getExternalResourceLocationsOfFilters() {
403        final Set<String> externalConfigurationResources = new HashSet<>();
404        filters.stream().filter(filter -> filter instanceof ExternalResourceHolder)
405                .forEach(filter -> {
406                    final Set<String> checkExternalResources =
407                        ((ExternalResourceHolder) filter).getExternalResourceLocations();
408                    externalConfigurationResources.addAll(checkExternalResources);
409                });
410        return externalConfigurationResources;
411    }
412
413    /**
414     * Returns a set of external configuration resource locations which are used by the checks set.
415     * @param checks a set of checks.
416     * @return a set of external configuration resource locations which are used by the checks set.
417     */
418    private static Set<String> getExternalResourceLocationsOfChecks(Set<AbstractCheck> checks) {
419        final Set<String> externalConfigurationResources = new HashSet<>();
420        checks.stream().filter(check -> check instanceof ExternalResourceHolder).forEach(check -> {
421            final Set<String> checkExternalResources =
422                ((ExternalResourceHolder) check).getExternalResourceLocations();
423            externalConfigurationResources.addAll(checkExternalResources);
424        });
425        return externalConfigurationResources;
426    }
427
428    /**
429     * Processes a node calling interested checks at each node.
430     * Uses iterative algorithm.
431     * @param root the root of tree for process
432     * @param astState state of AST.
433     */
434    private void processIter(DetailAST root, AstState astState) {
435        DetailAST curNode = root;
436        while (curNode != null) {
437            notifyVisit(curNode, astState);
438            DetailAST toVisit = curNode.getFirstChild();
439            while (curNode != null && toVisit == null) {
440                notifyLeave(curNode, astState);
441                toVisit = curNode.getNextSibling();
442                curNode = curNode.getParent();
443            }
444            curNode = toVisit;
445        }
446    }
447
448    /**
449     * State of AST.
450     * Indicates whether tree contains certain nodes.
451     */
452    private enum AstState {
453
454        /**
455         * Ordinary tree.
456         */
457        ORDINARY,
458
459        /**
460         * AST contains comment nodes.
461         */
462        WITH_COMMENTS,
463
464    }
465
466}
